intro: Nolana chancoana, commonly known as the Chanco nolana, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments and is often found in rocky or arid habitats. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
